text.div:
NameCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Immunization ResourceImmunization event information
identifier 0..*IdentifierBusiness identifier
date 1..1dateTimeVaccination administration date
vaccineType 1..1CodeableConceptVaccine product administered
VaccineType (??)
subject 1..1PatientWho was immunized?
refusedIndicator 1..1booleanWas immunization refused?
reported 1..1booleanIs this a self-reported record?
performer 0..1PractitionerWho administered vaccine?
requester 0..1PractitionerWho ordered vaccination?
manufacturer 0..1OrganizationVaccine manufacturer
location 0..1LocationWhere did vaccination occur?
lotNumber 0..1stringVaccine lot number
expirationDate 0..1dateVaccine expiration date
site 0..1CodeableConceptBody site vaccine was administered
ImmunizationSite (??)
route 0..1CodeableConceptHow vaccine entered body
ImmunizationRoute (??)
doseQuantity 0..1QuantityAmount of vaccine administered
explanation ElementAdministration / refusal reasons
reason 0..*CodeableConceptWhy immunization occurred
ImmunizationReason (??)
refusalReason 0..*CodeableConceptWhy immunization did not occur
NoImmunizationReason (??)
reaction ElementDetails of a reaction that follows immunization
date 0..1dateTimeWhen did reaction start?
detail 0..1AdverseReaction | ObservationAdditional information on reaction
reported 0..1booleanWas reaction self-reported?
vaccinationProtocol ElementWhat protocol was followed
doseSequence 1..1integerWhat dose number within series?
description 0..1stringDetails of vaccine protocol
authority 0..1OrganizationWho is responsible for protocol
series 0..1stringName of vaccine series
seriesDoses 0..1integerRecommended number of doses for immunity
doseTarget 1..1CodeableConceptDisease immunized against
VaccinationProtocolDoseTarget (??)
doseStatus 1..1CodeableConceptDoes dose count towards immunity?
VaccinationProtocolDoseStatus (??)
doseStatusReason 0..1CodeableConceptWhy does does count/not count?
VaccinationProtocolDoseStatusReason (??)

structure.purpose: This is the definition for the Immunization resource

definition.formal: Immunization event information.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: The base language in which the resource is written.
definition.comments:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource

Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.formal: A unique identifier assigned to this adverse reaction record.
Date vaccine administered or was to be administered.
Vaccine that was administered or was to be administered.
The patient to whom the vaccine was to be administered.
Indicates if the vaccination was refused.
True if this administration was reported rather than directly administered.
definition.comments: May need source of reported info (e.g. parent), but leave out for now.

definition.formal: Clinician who administered the vaccine.
Clinician who ordered the vaccination.
definition.comments: Other participants - delegate to Provenance resource.

definition.formal: Name of vaccine manufacturer.
The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.

mapping.map: RXA-27-administered-at (or RXA-11-administered-at location, deprecated as of v2.7)

definition.formal: Lot number of the  vaccine product.
Date vaccine batch expires.
Body site where vaccine was administered.

binding.name: ImmunizationSite
binding.description: The site at which the vaccine was administered

definition.formal: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.

binding.name: ImmunizationRoute
binding.description: The route by which the vaccine was administered

definition.formal: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.
Reasons why a vaccine was administered or refused.

definition.formal: Reasons why a vaccine was administered.

binding.name: ImmunizationReason
binding.description: The reason why a vaccine was administered

definition.formal: Refusal or exemption reasons.

binding.name: NoImmunizationReason
binding.description: The reason why a vaccine administration was refused

definition.short: Details of a reaction that follows immunization
definition.formal: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.

definition.formal: Date of reaction to the immunization.

mapping.map:
OBX-14 (ideally this would be reported in an IAM segment, but IAM is not part of the V2.x VXU message - most likely would appear in OBX segments if at all
)

definition.formal: Details of the reaction.
Self-reported indicator.

mapping.map: (no such concept seems to exist for allergy/adverse reaction in V2.x)

definition.formal: Contains information about the protocol(s) under which the vaccine was administered.

mapping.map: (V2.x doesn't seem to provide for this)

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. definition.formal: Nominal position in a series.
Contains the description about the protocol under which the vaccine was administered.
Indicates the authority who published the protocol?  E.g. ACIP.
One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.

definition.short: Recommended number of doses for immunity
definition.formal: The recommended number of doses to achieve immunity.
The targeted disease.

binding.name: VaccinationProtocolDoseTarget
binding.description: The disease target of the vaccination protocol

definition.formal: Indicates if the immunization event should "count" against  the protocol.
definition.comments: May need to differentiate between status declarations by a provider vs. a CDS engine.

binding.name: VaccinationProtocolDoseStatus
binding.description: The status of the vaccination protocol (i.e. should this count)

definition.formal: Provides an explanation as to why a immunization event should or should not count against the protocol.

binding.name: VaccinationProtocolDoseStatusReason
binding.description: The reason for the determining if a vaccination should count or why vaccination should not count.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

searchParam.name: _language
searchParam.documentation: The stated language of the resource

searchParam.name: location
searchParam.documentation: The service delivery location or facility in which the vaccine was / was to be administered

searchParam.name: performer
searchParam.documentation: The practitioner who administered the vaccination

searchParam.name: requester
searchParam.documentation: The practitioner who ordered the vaccination

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: The subject of the vaccination event / refusal
